phrasetype.name: PhotoPlog
phrasetype.phrase: Bad File - No File or File is too Large or of the Wrong MIME Type
Bad Open - Cannot Open the images Directory for Writing
Bad Type - File is of the Wrong MIME Type
Bad Name - File has a Bad Name
Bad Luck - Query or Count Issue, Try Again
Bad View - Cannot View this File
Bad Text - No Title or Description
Relative Links count does not match Absolute Links count
Maximum Number of Allowed File Uploads Exceeded
No Item or Item Not Currently Editable - Check Back Later
No Item or Item Not Currently Deletable - Check Back Later
Bad Inline - No Selection or Maximum of 20 Exceeded
Category Insert Query Failed - Try Again
Category Order Update Failed - Try Again
Are you sure you want to delete this category and all related subcategories?
Category Delete Query Failed - Try Again
Category Replace Query Failed - Try Again
No Item or Item is Now in Moderation Queue - Check Back Later
Cannot Set Category as Parent - Try Again
PhotoPlog is currently set to off in the PhotoPlog settings.
You need to first approve this file.
Set to '0' to not display this item

Allow HTML This applies to file description and comments. Titles do not allow HTML automatically, as they may be in links. No is highly recommended! Otherwise members could use HTML to attempt exploits!

Allow Description HTML This applies to the category description. Titles do not allow HTML automatically, as they may be in links. No is highly recommended, especially for categories that are created by members!
If you change the display orders, please be sure to submit the form using the 'Save Display Order' button at the bottom of the page
Make subcategories as necessary? <dfn>All matching files will be moved into the category indicated above if 'No' is selected.</dfn>
Number of files to be deleted :
Number of files to be moved :
Warning: Changes are permanent and cannot be automatically undone!
This will calculate the pixel width and pixel height of the images residing in the user directories and add width x height results to the database table.
If you choose to allow only one star rating per file per user, this will permanently remove multiple star ratings, leaving just the first star rating in place.
Edit Category Permissions for {1} in Category {2}
Use Default Permissions (Note: this will delete any previously set custom permissions)
Use Custom Permissions (Note: this needs to be checked to set custom permissions)
Maximum number to process per cycle
Exceeded maximum number of selections for field {1}

Not editable once set. The name is used only by admin for field management. It is not seen by users. Field management is useful for maintaining user responses to custom fields across categories. Certain responses to custom fields may be preserved across categories if the same field name is used in different categories.
If yes, field contents will only be seen by admin.
If yes, field is requested for new uploads and displayed.
If yes, field is inherited by child categories.
Field title that is displayed to users.
If yes, first option will be the default. If no, no default is set.
Display size for the input field.
If yes, a response is required for new uploads.
Number of rows for input field.
Number of options to display simultaneously. Enter 0 to display all.
Maximum number of options selectable. Enter 0 for no limit.
Number of radio buttons displayed per line unless wrapped by browser. Enter 0 to display all.
Number of checkboxes displayed per line unless wrapped by browser. Enter 0 to display all.
Enter the options that a user can select. Enter each option on a separate line.
Bad Field Name. A valid name must have between {1} and {2} characters.
Bad Field Title. A valid title cannot exceed {1} characters.
Bad Field Description. A valid description cannot exceed {2} characters.
Bad Max Length. Maximum allowed length value must be between {1} and {2}.
Bad Default. Length exceeds maximum allowed length.
Bad Size. A valid size must be between {1} and {2}.
Bad Height. A valid height must be between {1} and {2}.
Bad Limit. A valid limit must be between {1} and {2}.
Bad Number of Checkboxes per Line. A valid limit must be between 0 and {1}.
Bad Field Name. Name is already in use for the selected category.
Bad Field Name. Name is already in use by a sub-category and therefore the field cannot be inherited.
Bad Options. The number of options (lines) must be between {1} and {2}.
Field is protected. It cannot be edited or deleted.
Warning: Field deletion is permanent and cannot be automatically undone!
Note: The title and description fields, and fields that are inherited from a parent category, cannot be edited or deleted. You may still change the display order for such fields.
Note: The title and description fields cannot be edited or deleted.
Select a name or enter one below
Bad Field Name. Either select a pre-existing name or enter a new one.
Either select a pre-existing name or enter a new field name.
Update Gallery File and Category Counts
Update Postbit File and Comment Counts
Note: This is ONLY to be used to report spam, advertising messages, and problematic (harassment, fighting, or rude) comments.
Erroneous Data in Custom Field Database Table
Upload as User - Enter User Name

This will attempt to rebuild category datastore by processing all categories at once. If you encounter memory or timeout issues, go to the Category Manager, and for each category, click Edit and then Save to rebuild datastore, category by category.
Note that choosing delete will remove the selected items. This action is not reversible.
This will rebuild bitfields and return you to the ACP index page.
How many files at a time?
Files must be in the following directory:
Make sure the files are copies, as they will be deleted from the FTP directory upon import.
Click the continue button if your browser does not automatically redirect you.
Click an image to insert it into your message.
Creative Program (based towards depth of field)
Action Program (based towards fast shutter speed)
Is Members' Folder <dfn>When set to yes, this category will automatically create a user name sub-folder for uploads to this category.</dfn>
Act as Divider <dfn>When set to yes, this category will act as a non-upload category divider that only serves to group other categories.</dfn>

Open for Sub-Categories Can members create unmoderated sub-categories in this category? In theory there can be 'unlimited' (sub)categories, but in reality, having too many (sub)categories could hurt performance! There is no set answer to how many is too many, as this depends on server resources. However, consider using this option sparingly!

phrasetype.name: Front-End Redirect Messages
phrasetype.phrase: Thank you for the submission. It will be reviewed in due course.

phrasetype.name: Email Body Text
phrasetype.phrase:
$photoplog_username,
Visit $vboptions[photoplog_bbcode_link]/index.php?n=$photoplog_fileid to view the file.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

$photoplog_username,
Sorry, your suggested file titled "$photoplog_title" has been declined.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

$photoplog_username,
Visit $vboptions[photoplog_bbcode_link]/index.php?n=$photoplog_fileid to view the comment.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

$photoplog_username,
Sorry, your suggested comment titled "$photoplog_title" has been declined.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

$photoplog_username,
FYI, your suggested category titled "$photoplog_category" has been approved.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

$photoplog_username,
Sorry, your suggested category titled "$photoplog_category" has been declined.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]
Visit the $vboptions[bbtitle] ACP to moderate the file.
Visit the $vboptions[bbtitle] ACP to moderate the comment.
Visit the $vboptions[bbtitle] ACP to moderate the category.

$photoplog_username,
Visit $vboptions[photoplog_bbcode_link]/index.php?n=$photoplog_fileid to view the comment.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

$bbuserinfo[username] (mailto:$bbuserinfo[email]) has reported this item: $photoplog_item_url
This is part of this page: $photoplog_page_url
This is the reason that the user gave: $photoplog_reason
This message has been sent to the administrator. Please respond to this report as applicable.

phrasetype.name: GLOBAL
phrasetype.phrase: Click to close image, click and drag to move.

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Options
phrasetype.phrase: Small thumb links to Medium thumb
Small thumb links to Large thumb
Small thumb links to Original file
Medium thumb links to Large thumb
Medium thumb links to Original file
Large thumb links to Original file

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Global
phrasetype.phrase: Use your board info to make absolute links to your board.

phrasetype.name: Permissions
phrasetype.phrase: Maximum File Size<dfn>Set the maximum file size in bytes for each upload (512000 bytes is 500 KB, empty or 0 allows 'unlimited' size)</dfn>
Maximum File Limit<dfn>Set the maximum number of files a user may upload (empty or 0 allows 'unlimited' file uploads)</dfn>

Can Create Unmoderated Categories In theory there can be 'unlimited' (sub)categories, but in reality, having too many (sub)categories could hurt performance! There is no set answer to how many is too many, as this depends on server resources. However, consider using this option sparingly!

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Turn PhotoPlog on with the yes option or off with the no option.
When PhotoPlog is off, enter a reason to show users. PhotoPlog admins retain access to PhotoPlog.
The HTTP relative or absolute link where PhotoPlog is located, no ending slash: /photoplog or http://www.example.com/photoplog
The HTTP absolute link where PhotoPlog is located, no ending slash: http://www.example.com/photoplog
The server path where PhotoPlog is located, no ending slash: /home/example/public_html/photoplog
Directory in PhotoPlog to hold the uploads, no beginning slash, no ending slash: images

Enter the variable names for variables that are to be put into a global scope, one entry per line, no dollar sign.

This is good for when you have installed another vB mod but it does not show in PhotoPlog.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: The CSS to use on category list thumbnails.
The CSS to use on newest thumbnails.
The CSS to use on random thumbnails.
The CSS to use on small thumbnails.
The CSS to use on medium thumbnails.
The CSS to use on large thumbnails.
The CSS to use on slideshow thumbnails.
The CSS to use on vB search thumbnails.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: The maximum file width,height in pixels for large thumbs, only numbers separated with a comma.
The maximum file width,height in pixels for medium thumbs, only numbers separated with a comma.
The maximum file width,height in pixels for small thumbs, only numbers separated with a comma.
The quality of JPG thumbs, only numbers: range is 0 (worst quality, smaller file) to 100 (best quality, bigger file).
The default thumb size when no size is provided.
When viewing a category, do you want to include thumbs from nested categories in the display?
When viewing the filmstrip, do you want to include all thumbs regardless of current category?
When viewing thumbnail strips like newest thumbs, do you want to include the thumbnail information?

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: The server path, not HTTP link, to the image to use for watermark. Leave blank for no watermark. Note: this works regardless of the dynamic link setting.
Where to place watermark on image.
The server path, not HTTP link, to the image to use for small thumb backdrop. Leave blank for no backdrop. Note: this is overridden by frontdrop and has no effect when the dynamic link is off.
If using backdrop image, the x,y position from upper left to place thumb, only numbers separated with a comma.
The HTTP link, not server path, to the image to use for small thumb frontdrop. Leave blank for no frontdrop. Note: this overrides the backdrop and works regardless of the dynamic link setting.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Number of random thumbnails to display on index.
Number of newest thumbnails to display on index.
Number of category thumbnails to display per page.
Turn the filmstrip on with the yes option or off with the no option.
Number of thumbnails to display on filmstrip.
Type of display format for category thumbnails.
If using block format, number of columns per row.
Select how to display newest thumbnails.
Select yes for a postbit legacy type feel to comments, otherwise select no.
Select yes to use Lightbox for the original file view, otherwise select no. You must have Lightbox installed for this to work. Note: Highslide overrides Lightbox.
Select yes to use Lightbox for the filmstrip file view, otherwise select no. You must have Lightbox installed for this to work. Note: Highslide overrides Lightbox.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Turn RSS2 feed on with the yes option or off with the no option.
Users can add ?count=X&cid=Y to the feed link to retrieve X records from catid Y. Enter the maximum number of records that can be returned by the feed.
Select the thumb size that the feed should use for image links.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Turn EXIF info on with the yes option or off with the no option. Note: you must have the Jhead binary for this to work.

The server path, not HTTP link, to the Jhead binary. Example:

Unix: /usr/local/bin/jhead
Windows: C:\jhead\jhead.exe

Don't have jhead? Get it at http://www.sentex.net/~mwandel/jhead/ and remember to set the jhead file to 755 permissions on your server!
Select the PHP function to use for executing the jhead binary. If you turn on EXIF info, make sure to upload a test image to see if your server allows the PHP function you select.

Check the items to use for display. Note: EXIF information is determined upon JPG file upload only. Go to the maintenance section to update EXIF information for JPG files that have already been uploaded. Also, not every JPG file will have all the checked EXIF information as cameras vary.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Turn Highslide on with the yes option or off with the no option. Remember to do the CSS edits listed in the readme.txt file located in the highslide directory!
Select yes to use the modified version; otherwise select no to use the original version. See the comments in the highslide-mod.js file for how the modified version differs from the original version.

Select yes to apply Highslide to images that are dropped into forum posts from the PhotoPlog selector pop-up window; otherwise select no. Important: make sure to test this feature before committing to its use, as images in posts may display differently depending on how and when they were dropped into posts.
Select the outline type to use on the Highslide pop-up image.
Highslide option to use on category list thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on newest thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on random thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on small thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on medium thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on large thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on slideshow thumbnails.
Highslide option to use on vB search thumbnails.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Select yes to allow only one star rating per file per user, or select no to allow multiple star ratings per file per user.
Number of browse boxes to show for uploads. Note that too many boxes could lead to memory or timeout issues.
Number of text boxes to show for uploads. Note that too many boxes could lead to memory or timeout issues.
Select yes to receive gallery related email, otherwise select no. Note: adds queries and does not override UserCP setting.
Select yes to send gallery related email, otherwise select no. Note: adds queries and does not override UserCP setting.
Select yes to always use a dynamic link to files, otherwise select no. If yes, file paths are hidden, but more queries and system resources are used. No is recommended!
Select yes to always use a static link in the [IMG] tag, otherwise select no. If yes, make sure to see the readme.txt file in the PhotoPlog htaccess directory.
Turn newest uploads and comments in vB search info on with the yes option or off with the no option. Check the main readme.txt file for the necessary template edits.

Select yes to use %whatever% LIKE queries in the PhotoPlog search and slideshow features. No is highly recommended as %whatever% LIKE queries are not optimized due to the leading % wildcard. Do not even consider changing this option unless your language consists of multibyte characters. Also see http://mysqlbigram.googlepages.com/ for a possible multibyte alternative.
